Today Érika is seeking a loan to buy a photocopier and goods, with the aim of increasing her sales and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies, a display case and shelving to increase the variety of products she offers her customers.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis de 41 años, es padre de dos hijos, por los cuales vela a fin de ofrecerles una vida digna y mejores oportunidades de educación. Su vida se ha visto plagada por desaciertos y malas decisiones. Pero a pesar de las situaciones vividas le sobran ganas de luchar en búsqueda de un mejor futuro para su familia. Cansado de buscar empleo y ver como las puertas de las oportunidades se le cerraban frente a sus ojos, decidió auto-emplearse y montar su propio negocio en su vivienda. Creó una pequeña tienda en la que comercializa productos de la canasta familiar, y los fines de semana abre al público un carro de comidas rápidas a fin de generar mayores ingresos y brindarle mayor  bienestar a su familia.
 Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de surtido para sus dos negocios con el propósito de incrementar su nivel de ventas y aumentar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis, 41, is father to two children for whom he strives to offer them a dignified life and better educational opportunities. His life has been plagued by mistakes and poor decisions. However, despite the situations he has lived through, he is still keen to fight for a better future for his family. Tired of searching for work and seeing the doors of opportunity closing before his eyes, Alirio decided to employ himself and set up his own business in his home. He established a small store in which he sells basic grocery goods, and over the weekends he opens a fast-food stall to the public in order to generate larger sales and provide his family with a better level of well-being. Alirio is now seeking a loan to buy stock for both of his two businesses with the aim of increasing his sales and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery goods.

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es: Norma microempresaria de éxito se dedica a venta de tortilla, y comida en su domicilio, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 20 años, inicia su negocio haciendo tortillas, poco a poco fue haciendo comida hasta hoy, tiene 54 años de edad, tiene tres hijos mayores quienes le ayudan en la administración en el negocio, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, cal, granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, perecederos etc.
texts.en: Norma's business is quite successful. She has been selling tortillas and other meals at her home for twenty years. She started with only tortillas but is now selling many other types of meals. She is 54 years old and has three adult children, who help her manage her business. She will use the loan to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare the food she sells, such as sweetcorn, firewood, lime, rice and other basic grains, sugar, oil, veal, chicken, vegetables, fresh fruit, etc.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs and cows.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 60 años de edad, es un campesino del municipio de Sonsón, dedicado a la agricultura desde su juventud. Actualmente cultiva fríjol, tomate de árbol y papa criolla. Con esta actividad ha logrado garantizarles a sus tres hijos acceso a la educación y una mejor calidad de vida.  
Desde hace 5 años decidió combinar la agricultura con la comercialización de productos, por lo cual en su municipio alquiló una bodega con el fin de comercializarlos. Con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras con lo que prestará el servicio de legumbrería.
Mario es un hombre lleno de sueños, por los que luchará hasta convertirlos en realidad, el más importante es comprar el lote en donde tiene sus siembres ya que alquiler es costoso lo que ocasiona reducción en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mario is 60 years old. He is a farmer from the area of Sonsón. He has been working in agriculture since childhood. Currently he grows beans, tamarillos, and yellow potatoes. Through this activity he guaranteed his children access to education and a better quality of life.

Five years ago he decided to combine farming and selling products, so he rented a warehouse in his community to market them. With the purpose of expanding his sales, he is requesting a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables using the loan for the vegetable service.

Mario is a man full of dreams, struggling for them until they become a reality. The most important thing is to buy the parcel of land he cultivates as the rent is expensive and reduces his profit.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 20 años y a su corta edad le ha tocado asumir grandes responsabilidades debido al fallecimiento de su padre. Su familia ha laborado por mucho tiempo en la fabricación de calzado en un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa, legado que hoy le ha tocado asumir por ser el hombre mayor. Labora en horas de la tarde en compañía de su medre debido a que en la mañana estudia.
Su mayor sueño es poder crear una marca propia para aumentar sus ingresos y garantizarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida. En pro de su proyecto de negocio, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de cuero e insumos para la fabricación de calzado escolar, con el fin de aprovechar la gran demanda del producto en la temporada estudiantil.
Su madre y sus hermanos son su gran prioridad. Su mayor reto es poderles ofrecer una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 20 year old youth and at his young age he has had to assume great responsibilities due to the death of his father. His family has worked for a long time making shoes in a little workshop located in his home, a legacy that today he has taken over since he is the eldest male. He works during the afternoon with his mother because he goes to school in the morning.

His greatest dream is to be able to create his own brand to increase earnings and to guarantee his family better opportunities in life. For the sake of his business project, he is asking for a loan to buy leather and supplies in order to make school shoes, in order to take advantage of the product demand in the student season.

His mother and his siblings are his greatest priority. His biggest challenge is to be able to offer greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy leather and supplies for making school shoes.

loans.name: Roman Alberto

texts.es:
Roman es un hombre de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, Roman es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con el apoyo de su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Roman pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Roman trabaja en el área de obras en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Roman se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de hospitalización y medicinas para su esposa, ya que sufre una penosa enfermedad y requiere con urgencia ser operada, de esta manera Roman espera poder aliviar en algo las dolencias y mejorar la salud de esposa, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder darles una buena educación a sus hijas y desea verlas convertidas en buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Roman is a 36-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago. He lives with his wife and two small children, whom he loves, and they are his main reason for living.

Roman is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who, along with his wife, puts all of his effort toward supporting his family. Thanks to the effort and support of his parents, Roman was able to study a professional degree in Civil Engineering. In his spare time, he likes to watch television and he occasionally makes a delicious dish of rice with seafood to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Roman works in the public works sector of a municipal company in his city. He works every day beginning in the early morning, and he can work for about 8 hours. He feels comfortable doing his job and believes that it is going well because of his strong performance and the kind way in which he treats others.

Roman is very appreciative of Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided, he will be able to pay for hospitalization costs and medicine for his wife, who is suffering from a painful illness and needs surgery urgently. With the loan, Roman hopes to improve her health and alleviate her suffering somewhat. He will continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of providing his daughters with a good education. He wants to see them grow up to be good professionals.

loans.use: to cover the health expenses of his wife.

loans.name: Agua De La Vida De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA DE LA VIDA DE VIACHA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: lechería y ganadería, macramé, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a macramé; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Agua de la Vida de Viacha” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. It is made up of six members and is headed by a board where Sonia is the president. The business that the members of the communal bank are in are varied and among them are: dairy and livestock, macramé, and sewing skirts.

The loan they are taking will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Sonia is a member. She says that it is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer, joining through invitation from a supporter of the institution that came to her home. Currently she has a macramé weaving business. This business she learned from her aunt some years ago.

The loan that she is now taking is to increase her capital (to buy wool) that she will buy in the El Alto markets at wholesale and later her creations are sold by order. This way of working permits her to generate income in order to maintain as much as possible her household, as she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training covering health and savings.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica es una microempresaria que se dedica a vender leñas ambulantes, y en su domicilio, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años. Es madre soltera con dos hijos menores, anteriormente era ama de casa y actualmente cuenta con su negocio para seguir adelante con su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de leña en acopio por la temporada del invierno.
texts.en:
Angélica, a small businesswoman, sells firewood in an itinerant manner and at her house.  She has been doing this for five years.

She is a single mother with two minor children.  Previously she was a housewife, and she now has her business in order to get ahead with her family.

She will use the loan to buy firewood for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
La señora Venancia  de 50  años de edad,  no tiene   hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y refrescos.
Doña Venancia sus clientes son los estudiantes y personas que a diario le visitan, familiares y amigos, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña Venancia está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de abarrotería como ser frescos, churros, galletas, huevos, leche, pan, manteca, harina, frijoles, azúcar, café, arroz, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su negocio porque tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Venancia su sueño es mejorar su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Venancia, age 50, does not have dependent children.  She lives with her husband in her own house.  The house is located in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  She has been selling groceries and soft drinks for three years.

Venancia’s customers are students, people who visit her business daily, relatives, and friends.  She is a hard-working woman with the desire to get her family ahead.

Venancia is requesting the loan to buy groceries like soft drinks, churros, cookies, eggs, milk, bread, shortening, flour, beans, sugar, coffee, and rice, etc.  With the support of the loan she intends to improve her income and her business.  This is because she will have more products to offer her customers.  

Venancia’s dream is to improve her business.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2013.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: El Baile Del 10 Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ella es Angélica quien se dedica a vender productos de trastes de  cocina plásticos, melamina, vidrio etc., tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, comercializa sus productos en los departamentos del país junto con su esposo que le ayuda a comercializar sus productos, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de cocinas como panas, platos de vidrio, platos de melanina, hoyas de aluminio, baldes plásticos, vasos de vidrios, vasos de plásticos etc., Lea tiene una farmacia y Víctor tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three members.  One of the entrepreneurs, Angélica, sells plastic kitchen utensils made of melamine, glass, and other materials.  She is 50 years old, and married with four adult children.  Her husband helps her with the business and together they market her products in the country’s departments.  She will invest the loan in purchase of kitchen items such as pans, glass dishes, melamine dishes, aluminum pots, plastic buckets, glassware, plastic cups, etc.  Lea owns a pharmacy and Victor runs a small general store from his home.

loans.use: to purchase  kitchen items such as pans, glass dishes, melamine dishes, aluminum pots, plastic buckets, glassware, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Denis Mauricio

texts.es:
EL señor Denis es una persona honesta responsable y muy trabajadora, vive al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de mariscos los cuales sale a vender a diario en su comunidad y en los barrios cercanos a la misma. 
Don Denis  está Solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: curiles, babosa y pancha. Espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho para que sus ventas aumenten y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que le solicitan este producto.
Don Denis espera que esta inversión le deje buenas ganancias para que mejore un poco su condición de vida y la de su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero 2013
texts.en:
Denis is an honest, responsible and hard-working person.  He lives with his wife and four children in the south of Honduras.  His business is selling sea food.  He goes out to sell it every day in his community and in the nearby barrios.

Denis is applying for a loan to buy more products such as oysters, molluscs and bluegills.  He hope that the loan will be a big help for him to increase his sales and to be able to satisfy the demands of his customers who are looking for these products.

Denis hopes that this investment will result in big profits so he can improve his and his family's living conditions a little.  He dreams that his children will finish their education and will become good people with better opportunities.

In Choluteca, Honduras, January 2013

loans.use: to buy oysters, molluscs and bluegills for his business

loans.name: Eben Ezer Group

texts.es:
La señora esta casada, 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella se dedica a la confección de tejidos, camisas, y pantalones, inicio este negocio siendo aprendiz y empleada en otro negocio, lo cual fue un necesidad para poder obtener otro poco de ingreso. Hasta el momento lleva  10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos de diferentes colores, esto para poder incrementar su producción de prendas que elabora, espera  en el futuro contar con una maquila. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, producción de tejidos, y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
The member is married. She is 58 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has two small children. She works in the production of textiles, shirts and pants. She began this business as an apprentice and employee in another business, which was a necessity as she needed to be able to earn another bit of income. She has ten years of experience, and has the support of her husband who works in commerce.

The group is coming together to ask for a loan and she will use it to buy fabrics and thread of various colors in order to increase her production of garments that she makes. She hopes in the future to have a sewing machine. The other members work in commerce, making textiles, and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabrics and threads of various colors for her weaving business

loans.name: Dormos Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socias microempresarias de éxito una de ellas es Xóchitl tiene 25 años de edad unión de hecho su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y venta de comida los fines de semanas, tiene 18 meses de tener su negocio ya que anteriormente era estudiante. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares como uniformes, faldas, camisas de damas, camisa de caballeros, cuadernos universitarios, Fulgencia vende carne de res, carne de cerdo ambulante, María Teresa los fines de semanas vende nacatamales, vende productos químicos como ambientadores y Eva vende los fines de semanas fritanga y los días de semanas hace y vende repostería.
texts.en: This group has four, successful micro-entrepreneurs. One of these members is Xóchitl. She is 25 years old and she is in a domestic partnership. She sells clothing and shoes, and food during the weekends. She has had her business for 18 months. Before starting the business, she was a student. The loan will be invested in the purchase of school supplies like uniforms as well as skirts, women’s shirts, men’s shirts, university notebooks. Fulgencia sells beef and pork by delivery service. María Teresa sells nacatamales (meat and rice in banana leaves) during the weekends and chemical products like air fresheners. Eva sells fried foods on the weekends and during the week, she makes and sells pastries.

loans.use: purchase school supplies, uniforms, skirts, women’s shirts, men’s shirts, university notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Libertad en Progreso es un banco comunal que está conformado por 12 mujeres quienes se dedican a las tareas del campo o trabajan en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete en Cuenca,  lugar de clima frió y amplias llanuras las mismas que son propicias para la crianza de ganado, su geografía le regala paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Esperanza, forma parte del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso desde hace 7 años. Tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal han concebido 4 hijos de 19, 15, 6 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión pintor, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
Doña María Esperanza cuida a sus hijos y se dedica a las tareas del campo, cría y vende  borregos, pollos y cuyes, también cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. Para tener un mayor ingreso también se dedica a cuidar el ganado de otras personas, todas estas actividades le permiten ayudar a su esposo en la dura tarea de mantener su hogar.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimento para sus animales y semillas para sus cultivos. 

Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Libertad en Progreso is a communal bank that is formed by 12 women who work on farms or in the city carrying out different activities.  They are kind, courteous and still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  They live in the parish of Victoria del Portete in Cuenca, which has a cold climate and ample plains, which are favorable for raising livestock. The geography gives them the gift of natural landscapes that they can enjoy.

One of the members of this group is María Esperanza.  She has formed part of the communal bank Libertad en Progreso since 7 years ago.  She is 36 years old, is married and in her marriage she has had 4 children of ages 19, 15, 6 and 4.  Her first two children study in high school and the last two are in the region's primary school.  Her husband is a painter and the house they live in is their own.

María Esperanza cares for her children and works on the farm.  She raises and sells sheep, chickens and guinea pigs.  She also works the land and what she farms is for the consumption of her family, and if there is extra she sells it.  To have a higher income she cares for the livestock of others.  All of these activities allow her to help her husband in the hard work of maintaining the home.

Her new loan will be invested in buying chickens, feed for her animals and seeds for her plants.

Her biggest goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy chicken, feed for animals and seeds.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Brenda que se dedica a vender cosméticos de la Avon, zermat, Vogue desde hace 10 años, tiene una hija es madre soltera, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como crema para cuerpo, crema para manos, crema para la cara, perfumen de varón y perfumen de dama etc.Meylin vende ropa nueva, prendas de platas y María José vende ropa, perfumen y granos básicos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members who are successful entrepreneurs. One of these is Brenda who has been selling cosmetics, i.e. Avon, Zermat and Vogue products, for ten years. She has a daughter and is a single mother. She will invest the loan in the purchase of Avon cosmetics, such as body, hand and face creams, perfume for men and women, etc. 

The other members are Meylin, who sells new clothing and silver items and Maria José, who sells clothing, perfume and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy Avon Cosmetics, such as body, hand and face creams, perfume for men and women, etc.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa es una microempresaria de éxito, es primera vez que hace préstamos a  la institución, tiene un taller de costura, vende mercadería como ropa nueva, ropa usada, carteras, zapatos etc. Actividad que viene realizando desde hace 15 años, su hija que es mayor le ayuda en el negocio, es casada y tiene 50 años de edad. El crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de ropa usada, carteras y calzados.
texts.en:
Luisa is a successful small businesswoman. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from the institution. 

She has a sewing workshop, she sells merchandise such as new clothing, used clothing, wallets, shoes, and other things. She has been doing this work for 15 years. Her oldest daughter helps her with the business. Luisa is married, and is 50 years old. 

The loan will be invested in buying used clothing, wallets, and footwear.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, wallets, and footwear.

loans.name: Las Del Saber  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Las del Saber es un banco comunal que está conformado por 9 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades y para aportar a la economía de sus hogares trabajan en tareas del campo, todas tienen un objetivo en común el cual es sacar adelante a sus familias, son mujeres amables, gentiles y responsables que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, lugar que tiene grande llanuras y hermosos paisajes, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Victoria, forma parte de la banca comunal  2 años y en todo este tiempo ha logrado estrechar los lazos de amistad con sus compañeras. Tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 1 año de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una hacienda donde trabajan.

Doña Victoria se dedica a cuidar su casa y a la cría y venta de cuyes y gallinas, también labora en la hacienda donde vive desde hace 5 años, ahí trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y  alimento para animales. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia y  más gallinas para dedicarse al negocio de venta de huevos.
texts.en:
"Las de Saber" is a communal bank which is formed of 9 women who work in different employment, and to contribute to the finances of their homes they work on the land.  They all have one objective in common, which is to help their families to get ahead. They are kind, courteous and responsible women, who still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. They live in the parish of Tarqui in Cuenca, an area which has large plains and beautiful countryside. Its architecture is a mixture of the modern and the ancient. 

One of the members of this group is Victoria. She has been part of the communal bank for 2 years and in this time she has managed to form close bonds of friendship with her colleagues. She is 28 years old, and she has married and in her marriage she has conceived 4 children aged 10, 8, 6 and 1. Her first three children are studying in a small school in the area. Her husband works as a day labourer. They do not have their own home, so they live in an estate where they work. 

Victoria works looking after the home and rearing and selling guinea pigs and hens. She has also worked on the estate where she lives for 5 years. There she works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. 

She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of hens, guinea pigs and animal feed. Her dream is to have her own home, and more hens so that she can work in the business of selling eggs.

loans.use: to buy hens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras, una de ellas es Ana del Socorro que desde hace 10 años hace y vende nacatamales  y sopas los fines de semana en su domicilio  y ambulante, es una mujer soltera y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para hacer nacatamales como carne de cerdo, hoja de chagüites, perecederos, vegetales, arroz, y para hacer la sopa hueso de res, verdura como yuca, chiltoma, cebolla dulce, chayote, culantro, sal, etc. Ivania vende comida y sopa los fines de semana en su domicilio, María vende enchiladas y Dora tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group comprises four members, who are all enterprising women. Ana del Socorro has been a member for the past 10 years. She sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and soup at the weekends from her home and as a mobile vendor. She is a single mother. 

She will invest the loan to buy raw materials, such as pork, banana leaves, vegetables, rice and perishable goods to make nacatamales, and items such as beef bones, and vegetables like yucca, sweet peppers, sweet onion, chayote, cilantro and salt, etc. to make soup. Ivania sells food and soup at the weekends at her home. María sells enchiladas and Dora has a grocery store at her house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as pork, banana leaves, yucca, sweet peppers, etc to make nacatamales and soup

loans.name: Luisa Flora

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Luisa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la playa y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Luisa se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceite, bebidas, golosinas y otros, de esta manera Luisa tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa, 43, lives in the city of Camaná with her husband and two small children, whom she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, puts all her effort into advancing her family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and having to work to meet expenses, Luisa was not able to study a degree, but she would have liked to do so. In her free time, she likes to go to the beach and sometimes she cooks a delicious "lomo saltado" (sirloin stir-fried with red onions and tomatoes) to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Luisa works in her small business selling groceries. She works every day starting very early in the morning, and she may work for 10 hours. Luisa is comfortable in her job, and believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and the friendly way she treats her customers. Luisa is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to buy a greater quantity of merchandise such as rice, sugar, vegetable stews, oil, drinks, sweets, and other things. This way, Luisa's business will be better stocked and she can serve more customers. So she will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Toribio Dario

texts.es:
Toribio es un hombre de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador  y entusiasta, que junto con el apoyo de su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Toribio no culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Caldo de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Toribio trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Toribio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de la habitación de uno de sus hijos, ya que este sufre una penosa enfermedad y requiere de mayor seguridad y bienestar en el ambiente que se encuentra, así pues Toribio seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y dar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Toribio, 37, lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago with his wife and his two children who he loves and are his driving force in life. Toribio is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who, with the support of his wife, put all of their efforts into getting their family ahead in life. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources, and because of the need to work to cover spending, Toribio was unable to finish secondary school, but very much would have likely to have studied a degree in Agronomy. In his free time, he likes watching television and sometimes prepares a delicious dish of Caldo de Gallina to share with his family.

Upon his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Toribio works as a laborer in a farm in his city. He works every day from the early hours of the morning and can work for approximately 8 hours. He feels content performing this work and believes that it is going well thanks to his hard work and the friendly way he treats others.

Toribio is extremely grateful to the Kiva loan lenders, as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to improve the bedroom of one of his children given that he is suffering from a terrible illness and needs greater safety and well-being in the environment in which he lives. Therefore, Toribio will continue working and making every effort to achieve his greatest dream of having his own home and giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve a bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Hech's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Hech is aged 52 years and married with five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for thirty years, Hech manages to earn about 19,000KHR per day and can save about 10,000KHR each day for their future needs. 

Hech is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy a buffalo to help her in the rice paddy. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to help her in her rice paddy

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 26, is widowed with two children residing in a rural village located in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Both of her children are dependents and still in school. For the last eight years, she has been struggling to feed her children by farming rice as a primary source of family income. She also works as a garment worker to earn additional income for her family. She can earn about US$8 per day.

This is the third microloan for Channy with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield from her rice paddy so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Fatiou Kiné

texts.fr: Madame Fatou kiné  est une habitante du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui exerce une double activité de commerce. Elle exerce  une double activité de vente de sandwich et de tissus( tissus teintés en particuliers. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer dans la gestion de la nourriture quotidienne de sa famille afin de soutenir son mari. Elle capitalise une expérience de 08 ans dans son activité. Elle a déjà remboursé 9 crédits antérieurs  au sein du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre.. De nouveau, elle  sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 300.000 francs CFA pour développer son activité. Une partie de son  financement sera prévu pour l’achat de tissus teintés et l’autre partie a l’approvisionnement  de denrées utilisées dans la préparation de sandwich. Son vœu est de satisfaire au maximum la demande de sa clientèle  et par conséquent accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux supporter ses charges sociales.  Elle souhaite devenir une grande commerçante dans le domaine import-export.
texts.en:
Fatou Kiné lives in Senegal. She is a married mother, who sells two types of goods: sandwiches and fabric (in particular stained fabric). With the profits from her business, she contributes to the purchase of food for her family to help her husband. She has eight years of experience in her business. She has already paid back nine previous loans at the UIMCEC branch, where she is a member.

Once again, she is asking for a loan of 300,000 FCFA to develop her business. One part of her loan will be used to buy stained fabric; the other part will be used to by food items used in sandwich making. 

Her wish is to completely satisfy the demand of her customers and consequently, to grow her profits to better cover her expenses. She would like to become a large seller in the import-export field.

loans.use: acheter des tissus teintés a revendre

loans.name: Jose Ivan

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, José pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culmina sus estudios, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones come unos riquísimos Tallarines Verdes, los cuales son su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, José trabaja brindando servicios de atención al público en un restaurante de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho ya que actualmente tiene una cocina en malas condiciones, que presenta desperfectos y fugas, de esta manera él podrá preparar de manera más segura sus alimentos, así pues José seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante.
texts.en: José, 28, is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, enthusiastic, and hard-working person who has a great desire to excel. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, José was able to study a degree in accounting. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he was unable to finish his studies, but he would like to have been able to do so. In his free time, he likes to play sports and sometimes he eats delicious tallarines verdes (noodles with spanish and basil sauce), which are his favorite food. On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, José works in service at a restaurant in his city. He works every day for about eight hours. He is comfortable in his work and believes that it is going well for him because of his good performance and the friendly way he treats his customers. José is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy a small stove, which will help him a lot, since the stove he has now is not in good condition. It has imperfections and leaks. This way, he will be able to prepare his food more safely. José will keep working to advance.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel  tiene 49 años, el se dedica al servicio de  peluquería desde hace mucho tiempo, esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre y enseño a sus hijos,  tiene su salón de peluquería que se encuentran ubicado en una zona estratégica de la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Miguel  utilizara este préstamo para la compra de un motor para su vehículo como también  material de peluquería y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejoramiento de su negocio, El Sr. Miguel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a  utilizar los beneficios para mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, su deseo del Sr. Miguel  es tener un  negocio estable tener una peluquería muy equipada.
texts.en:
Miguel is 49 years old and makes a living running a beauty salon for many years. He learned this activity from his father and taught his children. He has a beauty salon in the strategic zone of the El Torno neighborhood. 

This loan is his first within the institution. Miguel will use this loan to buy a motor for his car as well as beauty salon supplies. In this way he will increase his working capital. The reason for requesting this loan is to improve his business. Miguel faces challenges in his business that include growing his clientele. He will use his earnings to improve his family's quality of life. Miguel wishes to have a stable and well equipped business.

loans.use: to change his car's motor and for hairdressing materials

loans.name: Talula Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Soraya con 31 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad, ella vende sopas variadas en un mercado local , inicia su negocio vendiendo nacatamales y refrescos naturales, helado ambulante, actualmente ya cuenta con un tramo fijo en el mercado de la localidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como hueso de res, yuca, chayote, ayote, quequisque, naranja agria, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate, sal, culantro, mondongo, etc. Maria tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, Jeysi vende repostería y María Luisa tiene un taller de costura y bordado en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of four enterprising women. One of them is Soraya. She is 31 and married, with two minor children. She sells assorted soups in a local market. She started her business selling Nicaraguan tamales, natural soft drinks, and ice cream as a street vendor. Now she has a fixed place in the city market. She will invest the loan in purchasing ingredients like soup bones, yuca, pear squash, ayote (squash), quequisque (tuber), bitter orange, onion, sweet pepper, tomato, salt, culantro, tripe, etc. Maria has a small grocery store in her home. Jeysi sells pastries. María Luisa has a sewing and embroidery workshop in her house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like soup bones, yuca, pear squash, ayote (squash), quequisque (tuber), bitter orange, onion, sweet pepper, tomato, salt, culantro, tripe, etc.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto, de 56 años de edad, habitante de la comarca La Joya, en las  afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 9 hijos, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol. 
Él se dedica a cultivar granos básicos desde muy pequeño, se independizo al cumplir 22 años cuando se casó, inicio a sembrar con sus propios medios. Actualmente sus hijos mayores trabajan juntos con las labores de siembra, vende sus cosechas a orillas de la carretera y en la misma comarca donde vive. Parte de la tierra donde siembra es alquilada el necesita el financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizantes y una bomba de fumigación para evitar que se propaguen las plagas. Dentro de sus planes futuros desea comprar ganado para producción de leche y vender vacas paridas. Su mayor motivación es lograr darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sixto, 56 years old, is an inhabitant from the La Joya region, in the suburbs of Teustepe. He is married and the father of nine children. He is a farmer who sows corn and beans.

He has cultivated basic grains since he was very small. He became independent at 22 years old when he married. He began to sow using his own methods. Currently, his oldest children work together on the sowing. He sells his harvest on the side of the highway and in the same region in which he lives. 

Part of the land where he sows is rented. He needs the funding to buy manure, fertilizer, and a fumigation bomb to avoid the propagation of pests. His future plans include the desire to buy livestock for the production of milk and to sell recently-calved cows. His major motivation is to be able to give to his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and one fumigation bomb.

loans.name: Jeronima Francisca

texts.es: Jerónima es una microempresaria de éxito tiene 71 años y se dedica a la comercialización de artesanía, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, además de vender en su comunidad comercializa en los departamentos del país y vende los productos también al país de Honduras, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos como gallos disecados, hamacas, jarrones, ceniceros, cartucheras de cueros etc.
texts.en: Jerónima is a successful small business owner.  She is 71 years old and is engaged in the marketing of artisanal crafts.  She has been involved in this business for twelve years.  In addition to selling in her community, she markets her products in the country’s departments and also sells her products to Honduras.  She will use the loan to purchase products such as stuffed roosters, hammocks, vases, ashtrays, leather holsters, etc.

loans.use: to purchase products such as stuffed roosters, hammocks, vases, ashtrays, leather holsters, etc.

loans.name: Betania Liset

texts.es: Betania, de 42 años de edad, es una humilde comerciante  quien se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Ella nos cuenta que su segundo crédito le fue de gran ayuda  porque le permitió  comprar más mercadería y hacer crecer su negocio con productos que aun no tenía en inventario como artículos escolares, granos básicos, desodorante, sopas, jugos, ya que ella se siente muy  satisfechas porque ha logrado obtener mas ganancias. Hoy en día esta requiriendo de su tercer financiamiento  para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, regla, borrador, uniformes escolares como faldas, camisas, etc. Ella siempre espera seguir contando el apoyo de créditos Kiva.
texts.en: Betania is 42 years old.  She is a humble merchant dedicated to her small general store.    She says that her second loan was a great help to her because it enabled her to buy more merchandise and grow her business by adding products to her inventory that she hadn’t had such as school items, basic grains, deodorant, soap, and juices.  She is very pleased because she has been able to earn more profits.  Today, she is requesting her third loan to purchase school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, and school uniforms such as skirts, shirts, etc.  She hopes to always continue counting on the support of Kiva loans.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, and school uniforms such as skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Nohemi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Nohemí, 27 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante, madre de dos hijos, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, tiene un año en esta actividad. Ella sale a vender en su humilde carretón, el cual lleva de todo tipo de frutas frescas y verduras según la temporada, con esta actividad mantiene a su familia. 
Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar naranjas, melones, mandarinas, bananos, sandias, papaya, plátanos, lechuga, tomate, cebollas, papas. Para ella esta inversión le permitirá comprar más productos para vender y conseguir ingresos para mejorar su negocio y ayudar a pagar los gastos médicos de su madre. Uno de sus sueños es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nohemí, 27 years old, lives in the city of Granada.  She is the mother of two children and works in selling fruits and vegetables.  She has done this for one year.  She goes out to sell in her small cart, which holds all types of seasonal fresh fruits and vegetables.  Through this business she maintains her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy oranges, melons, mandarins, bananas, watermelons, papaya, lettuce, tomato, onion and potatoes.  For her, this investment will permit her to buy more products to sell and obtain an income to improver her business and help to pay for her mother's medical bills. One of her dreams to to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Silen

texts.en:
Silen, 27, is married, has two children and resides in a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia. For the last five years, she has been selling garlic and her husband works as a taxi driver to earn more income. She can earn about US$20 per day.

Silen has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid the loans. Now she is requesting a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy garlic seeds for her plantation. She hopes to grow more garlic so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy garlic seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Khul district, Samnang is 32 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice on 5 hectares of farmland while her husband works as a paid construction worker to earn additional income. Having been in this business for 10 years, Samnang can earn about 15,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Samnang with VisionFund.  She is going to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to increase her crops so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rosa Clotilde

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa está realizando su quinto crédito en el banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca lugar que goza de paisajes hermosos, verdes campos y su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente es trabajadora y muy amable quienes se dedican a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales y al comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 46 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, su última hija es soltera, trabaja y ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es dueño de un taller de carpintería en donde labora, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

Doña Rosa  se dedica a diferentes actividades  como es la cría de pollos y cerdos los que vende en su comunidad, cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa, también le ayuda a su esposo en el taller. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es agrandar su galpón de pollos y para tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Rosa is making her fifth loan in the communal bank Siempre Amigas. She lives in the parish of Valle in Cuenca, a place that enjoys beautiful landscapes, green fields and its architecture is a mixture of modern and old. Its people are hardworking and very friendly who work in agriculture and animal husbandry and commerce, still maintaining the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Rosa is 46 years old. She is married and through her marriage has three children. Two of them are married and live independently. Her last daughter is single, works and helps financially. Her husband is the owner of a carpentry workshop where he works. The house they live in is their own.

Rosa works in different activities such as raising chickens and pigs that she sells in her community, cultivating their land and the harvest is for their household consumption. She also helps her husband in the workshop.

Her new loan is going to be invested in the purchase of chickens and animal feed.

Her goal is to enlarge her chicken coop and to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Carmen Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca lugar que goza de paisajes hermosos, verdes campos y su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente es trabajadora y muy amable quienes se dedican a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales y al comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Carmen tiene 40 años de edad, está separada de su marido y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos, una hija es casada y vive independiente, su hijo soltero trabaja solo para solventar sus gastos personales. La casa en la que vive es propia.

La señora Carmen se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos, como es una mujer muy hábil aprendió corte y confección y ahora es una costurera profesional, trabaja en su casa de domingo a domingo sin un horario.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y materiales de construcción para construir un lavandería para lavar su ropa. 

Su meta es tener un taller con operarios.
texts.en:
Carmen is in her second loan cycle with her communal bank "Siempre Amigas."  She lives in Valle parish in Cuenca, a place with lush fields and beautiful landscapes.  The architecture there is a mix of modern and ancient, and the people are hardworking and very friendly.  The residents work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade, and they still maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

Carmen is 40 years old.  She is separated from her husband, with whom she has 2 children.  One daughter is married and lives independently.  Her son is single and works to pay for his personal expenses.  Carmen lives in her own home.

Carmen has a business raising guinea pigs and chickens, and as she is a very capable woman, she also learned dressmaking.  She is now a professional seamstress, and she works in her home every day, without a set schedule.

Carmen will invest this new loan in the purchase of fabric, and thread, and she will also buy construction materials to build a laundry room where she can wash her clothes.

Carmen's dream is to have a workshop and employees.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and building materials

loans.name: Luljeta

texts.en:
Luljeta, a 44-year-old villager and married mother of three children, lives in a district in the southeastern Albania area that has been known for producing high-quality onions and potatoes. The geographic climate and the type of soil both play an important role in creating such produce.  

Luljeta has been in the agricultural business for 20 years. Every year around springtime, she plants onions and potatoes in the land that she owns. She harvests onions by end of summer when they are usually dry and mature. She harvests potatoes by mid-summer. She then sells the produce to wholesale buyers. 

“This type of activity requires lots of labor work and exhausts me and my husband, who helps me out. However, this has been the best and only source of income for our family,” Luljeta said.

As soon as possible, Luljeta needs a loan to purchase onion and potato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase onion and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Bani

texts.en: Bani is a 45-year-old, energetic married woman and a mother of one child.  She has been running a cattle business for 20 years with the support of her husband. She has two cows and two goats and makes enough through her business. She has some past savings and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow.  She expects to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend some of it on bettering the life of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en: Anwari is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for five years. The man shown in the photo is Anwari's husband. They have two buffaloes to milk and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. They need to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to increase profits, Anwari requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers of her community. They hope to increase the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers of her community.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of five daughters and five sons. For the past five years, she has been running a milk sales business. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only income earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now, she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to school. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase the production capacity of milk. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase production capacity of milk.

loans.name: Mariglena

texts.en:
Mariglena has been a street vendor selling different snack items to school children for almost five years. She is a 24-year-old divorced mother of a 3-year-old child and is the only one to provide financial support for both of them. 

“It has been very difficult not receiving any child support, even though I was supposed to. I have been working and taking care of my child at the same time and this is what has added stress on me, running from one thing to the other all the time,” Mariglena said.

Mariglena is requesting a loan for the first time to repair major leaks in the ceiling of their tiny home. A loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek will be enough to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To repair major leaks in the ceiling of their tiny home

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 26-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of clothing sales for six years, with the support of her husband. She is expert in stitching clothes while her husband sells them to the people of her community and in the local market. In this way, they are able to manage their household expenses. Mumtaz is passionate about her work and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her, nearly every day. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. The loan would help her to purchase more raw materials, such as cloth, spools of thread, and zippers in various colors, to meet the customers’ demand, time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings through her increased sales and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members. She dreams to expand her business, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business, such as cloth, spools of thread, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is 51 years old and born in Kajumbajumba, Kyafoora, in rural Rukungiri.

Benon is a farmer carrying out cattle rearing. This is with the aim of earning more income through sell of milk and bulls.

However, Benon found it hard to maintain his business of cattle rearing with his own limited income. He realised that he always had to forcefully sell one or two cows before their due time in order to maintain the farm and buy veterinary drugs.

In 2010 he decided to join a financial lending institution for financial assistance, and later found out that UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI)had the fairest and affordable rates.Benon is now able to maintain his farm without selling his cows before they are mature enough and also get enough milk from the cows. This is a result of the financial help got from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), especially the Rukungiri Branch.

He is also able to educate his seven children, who are all now attending school at different education levels. He can, also, cater for the household needs, hence improving on the family’s standard of living and livelihood. He can now do that with ease without affecting his business.

Benon is thankful to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) because their services of reaching the rural poor have changed lives of many.

loans.use: To buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un homme marié.Il est père de trois enfants.Deux de ses enfants vont à l'école.Il exerce le métier de commerçants de produits agricoles et céréaliers.Il achète en gros des sacs haricots auprès des producteurs dans les vilages pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter de l'arachide et du mil qu'il va stocker et revendre au bout de 8 mois. L'emprunteur tient ici sur la photo un carnet de sociétaire de l'UIMCEC dans les locaux de l'institution.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a married man, and the father of three children. Two of his children attend school. Abdoulaye is employed as an agricultural and grain trader. He purchases sacks of beans wholesale from producers in nearby villages and resells them at weekly markets in his district.

Abdoulaye earns enough income as a merchant to enable him to meet his needs and those of his family. With the aim of expanding his business, Abdoulaye is seeking a loan of 300,000 XOF to purchase peanuts and millet. He plans to store these and resell them after eight months.

Abdoulaye is pictured in the UIMCEC loan office holding his passbook .

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and millet

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Sayhua” está bien organizado y conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  La mayoría de los socios se dedican a la venta de comida, productos de primera necesidad,  verduras  y muebles de madera. 
La socia Beatriz continúa en el banco comunal y con el negocio de la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio de la crianza de animales y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad la socia Beatriz desea comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La socia Leonor es una socia pasiva que está en el grupo). 

Urubamba  está ubicado en el distrito, provincia y departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón del  valle sagrado de los incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes, por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sayhua" is well organized and comprised of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead. With their daily effort, they are looking to give their children a better future. Most members are involved in sales of food, basic products, vegetables, and furniture. 

Beatriz is still in the communal bank and raising small animals like guinea pigs. She has had the business of raising animals for several years, and it is going great thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Beatriz wishes to buy merchandise like guinea pigs. 

The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them, and they pledge to make their payments on time.  (Leonor is a passive member of the group).  

Urubamba is in the district, province and department of Cusco, the very heart of the ancient citysacred valley of the Incas. It’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, historic city center, scenery, history and for being a charming city in the southern region of the country.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Belinda Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Belinda es una muy buena persona emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora vive con  sus hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  fábrica de tortillas. 
Doña Belinda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de maíz, leña y cal con el préstamo espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más producto  que ofrecer a los clientes. 
Doña Belinda espera cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea que su situación y la de su familia mejoren con esta inversión.
Doña Belinda espera  que en 1 año  su negocio este posicionado como  el negocio  más grande y  reconocido de su caserío y así poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Mrs. Belinda is a good person; she has an entrepreneurial spirit, is responsible and hardworking. She lives together with her children in a community located in the south of Honduras.

Mrs. Belinda makes tortillas and is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, hoping to increase her sales by having more products to offer her clients.

Belinda hopes to cover all her needs, and at the same time that her and her family’s situation improves with this investment. She expects her business to become the most popular one in her small village in a year, in order to continue supporting her children so that they can grow to be persons of good character.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: Cordiales saludos este es el grupo “Hacienda Chacrasana” con 08 integrantes trabajadores y entusiastas, la cual pasan a su 7 ciclo. Milagros de 29 años conviviente con 02 hijos menores de edad. Actualmente cuenta con una bodega, la cual brinda productos de primera necesidad. Sus padres fueron quienes la motivaron a emprender su propio negocio, con su trabajo y dedicación a mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. Su siguiente meta es de poner un restaurante, pues eso le generaría mayores ganancias. El grupo “Hacienda Chacrasana” están agradecidos con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que hace posible su progreso. Milagros es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo blanco y pantalón celeste.
texts.en: Greetings from the "Hacienda Chacrasana" group, with has eight hard-working and enthusiastic members that are now moving on to their seventh cycle.  Milagros is 29 years old and lives with her two children, both of whom are minors.  She currently has a small grocery store that sells staple foods.  Her parents were the ones that motivated her to start her own business and with her work and dedication she has improved her family's quality of life.  The loan she is applying for will be used to buy merchandise such as groceries, drinks and sweets.  Her next goal is to start a restaurant.  This would generate higher profits.  The "Hacienda Chacrasana" group is grateful to Kiva lenders, as they are making progress possible.  In the picture, Milagros is second from the right, wearing a white top and blue trousers.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Maria Catarina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Catarina esta soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación media, se dedica a la talabartería, a la elaboración de calzados para mujeres, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su señor padre, hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de pieles, suelas y una maquina de costura, quiere aumentar su producción de calzados y mejorar sus ingresos en ganancias, para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Catarina is 21 years old and single. She studied for three years at middle school. She makes a living as a cobbler, making women's footwear. She started this business thanks to the support of God. She now has two years of experience.

She is applying for a loan to buy leather, shoe soles, and a sewing machine. She would like to increase her production of footwear and improve her earnings and profits in order to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bed sheets, duvets and mosquito nets

loans.name: Cruzloma  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cruzloma está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por el sector del Descanso en la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector está rodeado de varias montañas las cuales le regalan hermosos paisajes, sus verdes campos le dan un toque especial. Su gente se dedica a diferentes actividades económicas como es la agricultura, la crianza de animales y el comercio. Las socias de este banco comunal son mujeres luchadoras que día a día luchan para sacar adelante a sus familias y mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Esperanza, forma parte del  banco comunal desde hace 4 años. Tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes. Ella vive sola en su casa propia.

Doña María Esperanza se dedica a la venta de una gran variedad de granos secos como: maíz, trigo, cebada, café en grano, etc. tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad en donde trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.  En su casa también se dedica a la cría de cerdos y ganado. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de granos secos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su meta es agrandar mucho más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Cruzloma communal bank is made up of seven women who live in the area of Descanso in the city of Cuenca. This region is surrounded by several mountains, which give it beautiful landscapes. The green fields give the area a special touch. The local people work in various economic activities, such as agriculture, raising livestock, and commerce. The members of this communal bank are tenacious women who fight daily to provide for their families and improve the financial stability of their households.

One of the members of this group is María Esperanza. She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years. She is 62 years old. She is a single mother of two children, both of whom are adults, married and living independently. She lives alone in her own house.

María Esperanza makes a living selling a variety of dry grains such as corn, wheat, barley, coffee beans, etc. She has her own stall in a market in the city where she works from Sunday to Sunday, without a fixed schedule. She also raises pigs and cattle at home.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of dry grains in order to continue growing her business.

Her goal is to expand her business much more.

loans.use: to buy dry grains.

loans.name: San Pablo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pablo está formado por 12 mujeres que son amigas y vecinas,  viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida como el mirador de la ciudad ya desde su parte más alta se admira gran parte de la ciudad, existen varios lugares para disfrutar de la gastronomía y la calidez de su gente. Las socias de este banco comunal son mujeres luchadoras, amables y gentiles que trabajan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mariana, forma parte del banco comunal San Pablo desde hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo ha afianzado su amistad con todas sus compañeras del grupo, le gusta el banco comunal porque todas son solidarias y se apoyan mutuamente.

La Señora Mariana tiene 46 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre con quien comparte todos los gastos del hogar.

Doña Mariana se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa, labora en esta actividad de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, cerdos y ganado, estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener una mayor variedad y también alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener una boutique y así vender desde un solo lugar toda su mercadería.
texts.en:
The San Pablo communal bank has twelve women as members.  They are friends and neighbours, living in the surrounding area of the Turi parish in Cuenca.  This parish is recognised for being the viewing point of the city as, at its highest point, you can admire a large part of the city.  There are various places where you can enjoy the local cuisine and experience the warmth of the area's people.  The members of this communal bank are feisty, friendly and kind.  They work every day to improve their financial stability at home and to move their families forward.

One member of this group is Mariana.  She has been with the San Pablo communal bank for four years and, in this time, she has built relationships with all other members of the group.  She likes the communal bank as everybody is caring and everybody supports each other.

Mariana is 46 years old.  She is single and has no children.  She lives with her mother, with whom she shares the cost of household bills.  

Mariana is a street vendor who sells clothes.  She does this from Monday to Friday but has no fixed timetable.  At home, she raises and sells chickens, pigs and cattle, work that gives her the opportunity to improve her income.

This new loan will be invested in buying clothes so as to have a greater variety, and also to buy feed for her animals.

Her goal is to have a shop and so to sell all her merchandise from one place.

loans.use: to buy clothes and animal feed.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y junto a sus tres hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ana trabaja muy duro elaborando tortillas y platillos típicos como empanadas, yuca frita, enchiladas y otras, con esto Ana pueda brindarle ayuda a su esposo lo que les ayuda a contar con una estabilidad mejor. Ana trabaja de esta manera desde hace 12 años por lo que está muy posicionada en la zona contando con una gran cantidad de clientes fijos. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y así mejorar la estabilidad de su negocio comprando leña, maíz, y cal para elaborar más tortillas y así mismo verduras, frutas, leches y otros ingredientes más para elaborar más platillos típicos que vende día con día. Ana es una persona muy responsable y con buena moral, características muy positivas para una persona que se esfuerza para ser mejor día con día.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband, who is a builder, and their three children, all of whom are studying.  Ana works very hard making tortillas and typical dishes such as empanadas (a meat filled pastry), fried yucca, enchiladas and other items.  Through this work Ana can help her husband and so they have more stability.  Ana has been doing this work for twelve years and so she is very well established in the area and has a lot of regular customers.  Ana is applying to Integral to improve the stability of her business by buying firewood, corn and lime to make more tortillas, and also fruit and vegetables, milk and other ingredients to make other typical dishes that she sells every day.  Ana is a very responsible and moral person.  These are very positive characteristics for someone who is putting in the effort day after day to become better.
.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for making and selling foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, and products to make typical dishes.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia de 24 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia heredada por su madre, lo que significa una inmensa ayuda para ella. Claudia con el deseo de sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle lo mejor, trabaja en su casa de habitación elaborando tortillas, un negocio bastante estable ya que estas se consumen a diario por todas las personas. Claudia es trabajadora, amable lo que le agrada mucho a los clientes, como también aseada y responsable, quien trabaja de lunes a domingo.
